posts.author: Dew
posts.title: 7 - Dr. Linus
posts.text:
Episode 7  Dr. Linus
Written by: Edward Kitsis & Adam Horowitz
Directed by: Mario Van Peebles
 with Ben running through the Jungle on the island. He knew a way to get out of the Temple. As he runs, he trips and falls face down to the ground. As he raises himself up on his forearms, he can see Ilana, Frank, Sun and Miles walking and carrying torches. Out of breath, he gets up and runs to them. He surprises Frank, who cocks his rifle, stops and aims at Ben and doesn't lose his torch. Everyone is startled. Ben is panting. Ilana gets in front of Ben.]
FRANK : Whoa!
SUN : Oh!
ILANA : Where's Jarrah?
BEN : I'm fine. Thank you.
ILANA : Where is he?!
BEN : Considering that he just killed Dogen, I don't think he's goanna be joining us.
SUN : Who's Dogen?
MILES : The guy in charge of the Temple.
BEN : Sayid killed the interpreter, too.
ILANA : Are you sure?
BEN : He was standing over their dead bodies holding a bloody dagger, so, yeah, I'm pretty sure.
SUN : You said we were safe at the Temple.
ILANA : That's what I was told.
BEN : Well, what about the beach?
ILANA : What beach?
BEN : Were we buried Locke, where they lived. At least we'll have the water at our backs and it's familiar territory. Anybody else got a better idea?
[The camera focuses on Frank, then Sun, then Miles. No one speaks.]
ILANA : No. The beach it is.
SUN : [pointing] That way.
ILANA : Move.
[A partial time skip sound is heard then the scene switches to a classroom where Ben is teaching history.]
BEN : ...and it was on this island that everything changed.
[Ben prints and underlines ELBA on the blackboard. He turns and walks up an aisle.]
BEN : That everything finally became clear, Elba. It's where Napoleon faced his greatest test because exile wasn't the worst of his fate. What was truly devastating to him was the loss of his power. Sure, they allowed him to keep the title of emperor, but without any power, it was meaningless. He might just as well have been dead.
[The school bell rings, signaling the end of the class session. The students get up and start gathering their belongings.]
BEN : All right, remember five and six tomorrow. Thank you.
[There are various conversations as the students leave the room. A man enters the room and looks at Ben.]
BEN : Principal Reynolds. Good morning.
PRINCIPAL REYNOLDS : Walk with me.
[As the principal exits the classroom, Ben follows him. They walk along a school corridor.]
PRINCIPAL REYNOLDS : Linus, there's been a slight schedule shift. I'm going to need you to supervise detention after school today.
BEN : What?
PRINCIPAL REYNOLDS : In fact, all week. Cutbacks, budget crises, events above your pay grade, needless to say, some of us have to pull double duty.
BEN : But we have history club today. Those kids need me ...
PRINCIPAL REYNOLDS : [interrupts] There are five students in history club, Linus. They'll live.
BEN : Shouldn't we be encouraging the ones with ambition?
PRINCIPAL REYNOLDS : [smugly] Spare me. The club isn't for them. It's for you . It makes you feel needed. Unfortunately for now, you're needed [pause] in detention. Thanks for your understanding, Linus.
[The principal turns and walks away from Ben.]
BEN : It's Dr. Linus, actually.
 teacher's lounge. Ben is removing a container, containing sushi, with his name written on top, a bottle of soy sauce and a small plastic covered container. Chopsticks are under the label with his name on it. A teacher starts to speak.]
LESLIE ARTZ : Oh, for the love of [pause] it's ruined. It's ruined! Ohh!
[Ben sits at the table with Artz.]
BEN : What's the problem, Leslie?
LESLIE ARTZ : Oh formaldehyde. For, formaldehyde's the problem.
[Artz rubs his shirt with a napkin.]
LESLIE ARTZ : You know what gets out formaldehyde? Nothin'. Maybe if I had some frickin' lab aprons, I wouldn't have to pay for our incompetent students with another trip to Marshals.
BEN : Budget cutbacks.
LESLIE ARTZ : How hard would it be for Reynolds to spread a little of the love to the sciences? You know, I'm dealing with lab equipment in there from the 1950's. Now why is that?
BEN : Principal Reynolds is an administrator. He's not a teacher. He's forgotten what the public school system is about.
[Artz takes a bit of his sandwich and speaks while chewing it.]
LESLIE ARTZ : Yeah, summers off in exchange for a crap pension. I'm happy to remind him.
BEN : [firmly] No, taking care of the kids. That's what's important.
LESLIE ARTZ : Okay. You just keep dreamin'.
BEN : Oh, I know you've given up, but [pause] I refuse to.
LOCKE : [speaking with food in his mouth] Maybe you should be the principal.
LESLIE ARTZ : So says the substitute.
BEN : What do you mean, I should be the principal?
LOCKE : It just sounds like you care about this place. And if the man in charge doesn't, then maybe it's time for a change.
BEN : I appreciate the sentiment but who's gonna listen to me?
[Locke takes a sip of his beverage and raises his hand.]
LOCKE : I'm listenin'.
[Artz looks at Ben as Ben ponders the thought. A partial time skip sound is heard and the scene switches back to the island. Sun, frank, Ilana, Miles and Ben walk swiftly through the jungle. Miles speaks with Ben.]
MILES : How about you tell me what that thing back there was?
BEN : That thing's what killed her friends back at the statue.
ILANA : And Jacob, right. It killed Jacob, too.
BEN : Yeah, of course. And Jacob.
[Ilana walks right up to Ben. They are face to face.]
ILANA : Of course.
[Ben looks at Ilana with anxiety.]
ILANA : You're Miles, right? Miles Straume. You communicate with the dead.
MILES : Not technically. I [pause] I can tell you how someone died, pick up their last thoughts before they check out but I need to be near their bodies.
[Ilana hands Miles a leather pouch.]
ILANA : This is what's left of Jacob's body. So tell me Miles, how did he die?
[Miles kneels on the ground holding the leather pouch in his left hand. He has his right hand above the pouch. He closes his eyes and begins to concentrate. He hears indistinct whispers, twice, that the others cannot hear. Slowly he stands up and turns to Ilana.]
MILES : Linus killed him.
BEN : What? That's not true!
[Ilana glares at Ben.]
ILANA : [to Miles] Are you sure?
MILES : Well, he was standing over Jacob's dead body with a bloody dagger, so, [pause] yeah, I'm pretty sure.
[Ben doesn't move a muscle. Frank and Sun look at Ben in amazement.]
ILANA : Thank you. [to Ben] Jacob was the closest thing I ever had to a father.
[Ilana turns and walks away from Ben.]
MILES : Uh oh.
[Miles follows Ilana and Sun. Frank looks back a Ben for a moment then joins the group. It is nighttime. Ben is agape at what just transpired, getting caught in a lie.]
LOST logo
[It is now day time and Ilana is walking through the jungle foliage carefully. She is followed by Sun, Miles, Frank and Ben. They are at the beach camp which was once used by the Oceanic 185 survivors. The camp is desolate. Ben stops and watches the group.]
ILANA : I'm gonna look for some tools and get to work on some shelter. The rest of you see what food's left, maybe get a fire going.
MILES : [sarcastically] Yeah, a fire will fix everything.
[As Miles walks away, Ilana looks at some of the old fuselage. Ben approaches her.]
BEN : Is there anything you'd like me to do?
[She ignores Ben and pulls some wire from the piece of metal. Ben walks away with Sun. Ben walks to face Ilana then stops.]
BEN : You know, psychics [pause] totally unreliable.
[Ilana pulls the wire completely from the fuselage.]
BEN : Miles actually tried to blackmail me once into ...
[Ilana picks up her rifle and walks away from Ben. Frank approaches him and walks by him.]
FRANK : You make friends easy, doncha?
[A partial sound skip is heard and the scene switches to a house off island. In the background is the faint voice of a sportscaster. Ben is standing in front of a microwave as it beeps. He opens the door to take out a pre-made meal and burns his fingers. He drops it on a tray and walks to a kitchen table. The sportscaster's voice becomes clearer.]
SPORTSCASTER : And on top of that, they'll have to convert on a two point conversion to make it a tie game.
[Ben places the food tray on the table in front of older man wearing glasses and using oxygen.]
BEN : I made you one of the turkey meals with the cranberry sauce that you like.
ROGER LINUS : It ain't one of them "lean" deals, is it?
BEN : No, dad. It's organic. I'm trying to keep you healthy.
[Roger continues with his crossword puzzle.]
ROGER LINUS : Well, it's a little too late for that.
[Roger puts down the paper as Ben sits at the table.]
ROGER LINUS : How was work?
BEN : I have a doctorate in Modern European History [uncouples the oxygen tank] and yet I'm babysitting burnouts in detention.
ROGER LINUS : Detention, huh?
[Ben removes the oxygen tank, walks it to a closet where he takes out a full tank.]
BEN : The worst of it is, as I look out at those ingrates that I'm tasked with watching, I can't help thinking [pause] that maybe I'm more of a loser than any of them.
[Ben replaces the oxygen tank. Roger stops eating and takes off his glasses.]
ROGER LINUS : This isn't the life I wanted for you, Ben. I wanted so much more.
BEN : I know.
ROGER LINUS : That's why I signed up for that damn Dharma Initiative and took you to the island, and [pause] they were decent people [exhales deeply] smarter than I'll ever be. Imagine how different our lives would've been if we'd stayed.
BEN : Yes, we'd have both lived happily ever after.
ROGER LINUS : No, I'm serious Ben. Who knows what you would've become.
[Bens turns on the oxygen.]
BEN : Now does that feel better?
ROGER LINUS : Ahh, yes. Thank you.
[As Ben begins to eat his dinner, the doorbell rings. Ben goes to answer it.]
BEN : Alex?
ALEX : Dr. Linus? Where were you today? We had to cancel history club.
[Ben opens the screen door.]
BEN : Oh, I'm so sorry. I should've put a note on the door. The club meetings have to be postponed. I am in detention all week.
ALEX : [smiles] Oh yeah? What'd you do?
BEN : Principal Reynolds needs me to cover, so ...
ALEX : A.P. test is this Friday. I was [pause] kinda counting on the tutoring.
BEN : All right, how about this? Tomorrow morning, 7:00 A.M. in the library [pause] and you bring the coffee.
ALEX : Thanks. God, you're the best Dr. Linus.
BEN : My pleasure Alex.
ALEX : Okay.
[Alex waves and walks away.]
BEN : See ya.
[A partial time skip sound is heard and the scene switches back to the beach camp on the island. Ilana has found a tool box and is pulling a piece of metal beam off a structure. She walks around then stops to place the toolbox and other items on a raised area. She starts working as Sun approaches her.]
SUN : Excuse me. How long are we going to stay here?
ILANA : I told you. I don't know yet.
SUN : I need to find my husband.
ILANA : Trust me, if anyone wants to find him, it's me but I don't know where to look.
SUN : [curious] Why do you want to find Jin?
ILANA : Because your last name is Kwon. So is his and I don't know whether I am supposed to protect you, him or both of you.
SUN : Protect us? What are you talking about?
ILANA : You're candidates [pause] to replace Jacob.
SUN : Replace him, to do what?
ILANA : If you're the one selected, I imagine you'll find out.
[Ilana continues to work with the wires.]
SUN : Wait. You said candidates. How many are there?
ILANA : Six. There are only six left.
 interior of the jungle. Hurley is lying asleep in the foliage. Jack is with him.]
HURLEY : Cheese Curds.
JACK : Hurley.
[Hurley groans and lifts his head up.]
JACK : Come on. Wake up.
[Hurley sits up and looks at Jack.]
JACK : Come on. Let's go. We can make the Temple by nightfall.
HURLEY : I'm hungry. Let's eat breakfast first.
JACK : No, we can eat on the way.
HURLEY : What's the rush? You know, maybe we should take out time?
JACK : Why?
HURLEY : Because.
JACK : I'm leaving, Hurley, you coming or not?
[Jack turns and walks away from Hurley. Hurley waits then follows Jack. The come into some thick foliage. They must make a decision.]
HURLEY : [points] It's this way.
JACK : No, we came this way.
HURLEY : Yeah but that was a mistake. This is faster. Trust me. It's just around here, it's a short cut.
JACK : Not it's not.
RICHARD : You're both wrong. [turns his head] Temple's that way.
JACK : Where did you come from?
RICHARD : You wouldn't believe me if I told you.
JACK : Try me.
RICHARD : Not yet. If you wanna go to the Temple, it's this way.
[Richard turns and walks in the direction he has pointed out. Jack and Hurley stay.]
HURLEY : Dude, you trust that guy?
JACK : At least he's not stalling.
[Jack follows Richard. Hurley slightly shakes his head and doesn't appreciate the comment. He follows Jack. beach. Ben has quickly opened the tarp doorway of one of the empty shelters and kneels. He has found books. Frank passes carrying firewood.]
FRANK : When you're finished in the library, give me a hand gettin' some more firewood.
BEN : Just looking for something useful.
[Ben picks up a magazine, covered with sand in his left hand. The cover reads, "Booty Babes Big Bouncy Beautiful Buns." In his right hand, he holds a book entitled "Justice and Truth in Action" by Benjamin Disraeli. Frank continues to pile the wood to make a fire.]
BEN : The things people will bring on a trip
[Ben picks up a bottle of water with an Oceanic label on it. The book next to it is entitled "The Chosen" by Chaim Potak.]
BEN : Oceanic.
[Ben walks out of the shelter on his knees, stops, not standing as Frank approaches him.]
BEN : I remember that plane breaking in half like it was yesterday.
FRANK : You sound nostalgic.
BEN : Maybe I am.
FRANK : You know, I was supposed to be flying it.
[Ben looks up at Frank and stares. He is surprised to hear Frank talk of 815.]
FRANK : Oceanic 815.
[Ben quickly stands up and is amazed at what he is hearing.]
BEN : And why didn't you?
FRANK : I overslept.
BEN : Come on.
FRANK : Can you believe it? Imagine how different my life would have been had that alarm gone off.
BEN : How different would it have been? The island still got you in the end, didn't it?
[Frank chuckles, smirks, and raises his eyebrows then walks away. Ben is smiling. Ben is caught off guard and a rifle is touches the side of his neck.]
ILANA : Walk.
[She glares at Ben. Frank stops and watches them. Miles looks also. Ilana motions with her rifle in the direction she wants Ben to walk. Ben begins to walk. As they climb a small hill, Ben waddles briskly. He stops to see the graveyard of all the Oceanic survivors who eventually died.]
BEN : Okay, wait. You don't have to do this if ...
ILANA : Stop!. On the ground, face down!
[Ben complies. Ilana takes some wire and attaches one end to a tree and the other Ben's ankle. It is a makeshift metal shackle. Ben looks back to see her tightening a bolt on the shackle.]
BEN : What are you doing?
[Ilana continues with saying a word.]
BEN : Look, if this is about what Miles said ...
[Ilana quickly stands with her rifle aimed at Ben. She motions with her head to her right.]
ILANA : Pick it up!
BEN : What?
ILANA : Pick it up and start digging.
[Ben reaches over and picks up and large piece of bamboo with one end cut on the bias and two holes apart from each other on the side.]
BEN : Dig what?
ILANA : A grave.
BEN : [voice cracking] For who?
ILANA : You murdered Jacob. It's for you.
 off island. In the school library Ben is helping Alex prepare for her A.P. test in History. A book is opened to Chapter 19. The title of the chapter is, "East India Trading Company."]
BEN : Now you know this. I know you do.
[Alex thinks for a moment then replies.]
ALEX : Expanded Lord Cornwallis' powers as Governor-General.
BEN : [nods] Very good. Now, moving on to the Charter Act of 1813. At the time of the charter the East India Trading Company's power extended to all of India except for ...
ALEX : [pause] Uh, ...
[Alex is thinking and becomes flustered. She throws her pencil on the table.]
ALEX : [frustrated] I don't know!
BEN : Okay, okay, it's just a test.
ALEX : Just a test? [sigh] It's only my entire life, Dr. Linus.
BEN : Alex, I think you're being a bit overdramatic.
ALEX : Am I? My mom works two jobs just to pay our rent. How am I gonna pay for college, let alone Yale? Assuming, I can even get in?
BEN : You're one of the brightest students I've ever had. I don't worry about your future at all.
ALEX : Really?
BEN : Really. Now what can I do to help? I'll write you a great letter of recommendation. I'll ...
ALEX : [interrupts] No, I need someone who went there. Unfortunately, the only one I know is that pervert, Principal Reynolds.
BEN : Excuse me? Pervert?
ALEX : Forget I said that. [pause] I was just angry.
BEN : Alex, has Principal Reynolds done something to you?
ALEX : What? Ew! [chuckles] No, I swear. It's not that.
BEN : Then what is it?
ALEX : [pause] Dr. Linus, if I tell you, will you promise to keep it between us?
BEN : Of course, I promise.
ALEX : [long pause] [whispers] Okay.
[Alex stands up and walks around the table. She takes a seat next to Ben. Ben looks around then sits back. He gives Alex his undivided attention.]
ALEX : [lower voice] So I was in the nurse's office a few months ago. I had a stomach ache and I just went in to find a cot and I fell asleep. When I woke up, after school, in the other room, Principal Reynolds was there. And the nurse [pause] well, I guess she forgot I was in there. They were, you know, doing it, in the room right next to me, where they give kids hearing tests.
[Ben closes his eyes tightly then opens them.]
ALEX : Isn't that totally gross?
BEN : Totally.
[Ben takes a long pause while looking straight ahead.]
ALEX : Dr. Linus, you're not gonna say something, are you?
BEN : No. No. A promise is a promise. [pause] Well, shall we return to the high seas?
ALEX : Yeah.
[Alex grabs her notebook from the other side of the table while Ben is in deep thought. A partial time skip sound is heard and the scene switches back to the island. Ben is making little progress on his grave-digging. He stops for a moment. Ilana is walking back and forth along the shoreline and watching Ben. Ben notices her and makes eye contact. Ben looks down at his grave, Ilana continues to walk the shoreline and Miles approaches carrying food in a banana leaf as Ben starts digging again.]
MILES : Not exactly tearing it up on the digging front, are you?
BEN : I'm not in a big hurry.
MILES : [unfolds the banana leaf] Brought you some grub. Hope you like green beans and banana 'cause it's all we got.
BEN : I'm not really hungry.
[Ben continues to dig. Miles picks up a green bean, eats a piece then walks away.]
MILES : Suit yourself.
BEN : Miles, do you remember once you asked me for 3.2 million dollars? Do you still want it?
[Miles turns around as Ben speaks.]
MILES : What are you gonna do? You gonna write me a check on this banana leaf?
BEN : I can get off this island and when I do I have a vast network of people and resources that will get you that money. All you have to do is cut me loose.
[Ben begins to dig again.]
MILES : Why would I need your money when there are a couple of jabonies under there [points to graveyard] named Nikki and Paulo who got buried alive with eight million dollars of diamonds on top of them?
BEN : I can't believe you're just gonna stand by and watch this happen. [nervous] Ilana's gonna murder me for killing Jacob, a man who didn't even care about being killed.
MILES : No, he cared.
BEN : Excuse me?
MILES : Right up until the second the knife went through his heart, he was hoping he was wrong about you.
[Ben looks at Miles surprised.]
MILES : [sarcastically] I guess he wasn't.
[Miles turns, waves and walks away from Ben. Suddenly a gunshot breaks the silence and lands next to Ben's foot. He looks up to see Ilana aiming right at him.]
ILANA : Dig!
[Miles stops, looks at Ilana, raises a hand, shrugs his shoulders and walk away. Ben continues to dig. the interior of the jungle where Hurley and Jack are walking behind Richard.]
HURLEY : So, you're not time traveling?
RICHARD : No.
HURLEY : But you look the same as you did thirty years ago. How is that possible?
RICHARD : Not easy to explain.
HURLEY : Is this like a "Terminator" thing? You a cyborg?
RICHARD : No, I'm not a cyborg.
HURLEY : Vampire?
RICHARD : Jacob gave me a gift.
JACK : Jacob? What do you know about him?
RICHARD : I know he's dead.
[As the three men approach a clearing, a ship, the Black Rock, is covered with foliage. As the camera pans from inside the ship and down onto the men, there is a pulley and some rope.]
HURLEY : I thought you said we were going to the Temple, dude.
RICHARD : I lied.
JACK : Why?
RICHARD : Because everyone at the Temple is dead.
[Hurley and Jack look at Richard. Jack walks to face Richard.]
JACK : What do you mean they're all dead? What happened?
RICHARD : I'm, [pause] I'm not sure what happened but I just came from there and there's no survivors.
JACK : What about our friends? Sayid, Kate?
RICHARD : They, they weren't there. Maybe they made it out alive. All I know is whatever you're looking for at the Temple [pause] it's not there.
JACK : [to Hurley] You didn't want to go back there. Did you know about this?
HURLEY : Jacob kinda sorta hinted at it.
RICHARD : You spoke to Jacob?
HURLEY : Yeah?
RICHARD : Well, whatever he said, don't believe him.
[Richard starts walking toward the ship.]
JACK : Where you going?
RICHARD : There's something I need to do.
[Richard picks up the pace. He is angry.]
JACK : To do what?
RICHARD : Die.
[ school where a teacher is marking test papers. He marks one with a large red F. As the door closes, Artz sees Ben approaching him. Ben stops and leans over the table.]
BEN : Hey, do you have a minute?
LESLIE ARTZ : Yes, I guess, might as well just give them all F's. Tell me, how hard is it to learn the difference between a genus and a species?
[The door closes again and Ben and Artz are the only two in the room.]
LESLIE ARTZ : [annoyed] What do you want?
BEN : You're pretty good with computers, aren't you?
LESLIE ARTZ : Something tells me you wouldn't even be standing here if you didn't already know that I was.
BEN : Could you, hypothetically, access someone's e-mail account without their knowledge?
LESLIE ARTZ : I [pause] yeah, it depends on the account.
BEN : Say a faculty account, hypothetically.
LESLIE ARTZ : Whose?
BEN : Nurse Kondracki.
LESLIE ARTZ : [impish smile] Kim? Why? You got the hots for her?
BEN : No, I'm just curious about some of her correspondence.
LESLIE ARTZ : With whom?
[Ben doesn't reply. Artz gathers up his test papers.]
LESLIE ARTZ : Okay, that's fine. I didn't come to see you. You came to see me. [walks away] I don't have the time to play twenty questions. Now you can either tell me what it is that you're doing or you can let me finish grading my papers in peace.
BEN : All right, all right. I have reason to believe that she might be engaged in an inappropriate personal relationship with Principal Reynolds.
LESLIE ARTZ : You're making a play. You're going after the big job, aren't you?
BEN : Are you going to help me or not, Leslie?
LESLIE ARTZ : [thinks] I want a good spot.
BEN : I'm sorry?
LESLIE ARTZ : I want Lamour's spot, in the main parking lot, the one next to the maple tree, not under the maple tree, next to the maple tree. That way I get the shade from the maple tree but not all that tree crap all over the hood of my car. And I want aprons. I want lots of aprons and I want some lab equipment in here that was built in this decade. Is that a deal?
BEN : Deal.
LESLIE ARTZ : You know, you really had me fooled with that sweater vest. [laughs] Linus, you're a real killer.
[Ben leans back and ponders Artz's comment. A partial time skip sound is heard and the scene switches back to the island where Ben is still digging his grave. He pauses a moment, panting. The grave is several feet deep. Black Rock. Richard walks into an area where skeletons are chained to the side of the ship. He stops, crouches and lifts one set of the shackles. Jack enters the area with a lantern.]
JACK : Been here before?
RICHARD : Yes. [pause][scoffs] And in all the time that I've spent on this island, today is the first time I've ever come back.
[Hurley is shouting trying to find Jack.]
HURLEY : Jack? Dude, where are ya?
JACK : I'm in here.
[Richard continues to look around. Hurley enters the area. Richard finds a crate and opens it. There are old, crusty sticks of dynamite and a roll of fuse wire. Suddenly he hears Hurley.]
HURLEY : [urgently] Do not open that. There's dynamite in there. It's mega unstable.
RICHARD : I know.
HURLEY : So did Dr. Artz , then I was wiping him out of my shirt two days later. [to Jack] Dude, it's time to go.
JACK : No, not yet.
HURLEY : He's opening up a crate of dynamite and he said he wanted to kill himself.
RICHARD : I can't kill myself.
HURLEY : What?
[Richard is preparing a fuse for the stick of dynamite.]
RICHARD : Even if I wanted to, and trust me, I do, I, I can't kill myself which is why I want you to do it for me.
JACK : What are you talking about?
[Jack approaches Richard.]
RICHARD : What I'm talking about Jack is that, well, Jacob touched me. And when Jacob touches you, well it's considered a gift except it's not a gift at all. It's a curse.
[Richard tosses the stick of dynamite on the top of a barrel.]
HURLEY : [Frightened] Dude,. seriously, let's go now!
JACK : Why do you want to die?
RICHARD : I devoted my life, longer than you can possibly imagine, in service of a man who told me that everything happening was for a reason, that he had a plan, a plan that I was a part of and when the time was right that he'd share it with me. And now, that man's gone. So, why do I want to die? Because I just found out my entire life had no purpose. Now if I light this myself, it, it won't work. But you can light it for me, Jack. I made the fuse long enough so you'll have time to get out.
[Jack nods.]
HURLEY : Jack, please tell me you're not actually considering this.
JACK : If he wants to die, there's nothing we're gonna do to stop him.
RICHARD : Thank you.
[Jack lights the fuse from the lantern and places it on a wooden barrel with the fuse hanging over the side. He sits across from Richard.]
JACK : Now, let's talk.
HURLEY : Jack! Dude, we gotta go. Guy's crazy and I know crazy.
JACK : Hurley, go ahead. We'll be right all right.
HURLEY : [frantic] Dude, you're gonna blow up!
JACK : Gotta talk to him Hurley. Just go.
HURLEY : No, I'm not going without you.
[Jack and Richard are staring at each other intensely.]
JACK : Hurley, I'll be fine.
[Richard looks at the fuse which is half way burned. It is almost to the top of the barrel.]
HURLEY : If you change your mind, I'll be like a mile away.
[Hurley runs out of and away from the Black Rock.]
RICHARD : You should go with him, Jack.
JACK : No Richard. No, I shouldn't.
RICHARD : Then you're gonna die.
JACK : [laughs] Actually, I don't think either one of us is gonna die.
RICHARD : What makes you think that?
[Richard has his eyes focused on the burning fuse.]
JACK : I just came from a lighthouse where my name was etched in wood on a dial that turned a mirror that somehow reflected the image of the house that I grew up in. Jacob's lighthouse. He got Hurley to bring me out there because he wanted me to see what was reflected in that mirror. For some reason he wanted me to know that he had been watching me ever since I was a kid.]
RICHARD : Why?
JACK : I have no idea why but I'm willing to bet you that if Jacob went to that trouble, that he brought me to this island for a reason and it's not to blow up sitting here with you right now.
[Richards quickly looks at the fuse, then Jack, then the fuse which is now on the top of the barrel.]
RICHARD : That's a pretty big risk you're taking, Jack.
JACK : Yes.
RICHARD : What if you're wrong.
JACK : [chuckles] I'm not.
[Richard nervously watches the fuse and Jack closes his eyes. The tension builds as the burning fuse nears the stick of dynamite. Suddenly, the fuse fizzles out. Richard gasps as Jack opens his eyes and exhales deeply. Richard is panting. He looks up at Jack, amazed at what just transpired.]
JACK : [smiling] Want to try another stick?
RICHARD : [very long pause] All right Jack. You seem to have all the answers. So, so now what?
JACK : We go back to where we started.
 graveyard at the beach. Ben is still digging. The rattling and tick tock sounds of the smoke monster begin. Ben quickly stops digging, stands and pays attention to the sounds as they get closer to him. He is familiar with the sound. As he looks in one direction a voice addresses him from behind.]
MIB/LOCKE : Hello, Ben.
[Ben quickly turns around. He is still holding the digging tool.]
BEN : What are you doing here?
MIB/LOCKE : Visiting. What are you doing?
BEN : I'm digging my own grave.
MIB/LOCKE : Why?
BEN : Because you talked me into killing Jacob. Do you see that woman over there eating a mango? She's his bodyguard and she knows what I did. So you've gotten what you wanted because she's going to kill me.
MIB/LOCKE : I don't want you to die, Ben. In fact, I went back to the statue to get you but you'd already gone.
BEN : [angry] Get me? For what?
MIB/LOCKE : I'm gathering a group to leave this place for good. But, once we're gone, someone's gonna need to be in charge of the island.
BEN : Me?
MIB/LOCKE : I can't think of a better man for the job.
BEN : Well, it doesn't seem very likely, does it, under the circumstances. How am I gonna get away from ...
[MIB/Locke raises his right hand a bit and the shackle around Ben's ankle opens up. Ben looks around trying to figure how this happened.]
MIB/LOCKE : Come to the other island, the Hydra Station. That's where we'll be.
BEN : She'll come after me.
MIB/LOCKE : Two hundred yards inland, there's a tree in the clearing with a rifle leaning up against it. If you go now, you'll get there first and you'll have the drop on her. [pause] But don't hesitate, she won't. See you soon, Ben.
[MIB/Locke walks back into the jungle. Ben slows his digging as Ilana watches him. He turns to look at Ilana then suddenly tosses the digging tool and bolts from the grave site. He runs into the jungle quickly.]
ILANA : Hey!
[Ilana follows Ben keeping up with him. Ben moves foliage out of the way while running. He turns his head occasionally to see where Ilana is. She is still right behind him. A partial time skip sound is heard then the scene switches back to the school. Ben is standing in front of Principal Reynolds office door. He pauses then knocks.]
PRINCIPAL REYNOLDS : Come in.
[Ben enters the office. Upon seeing him, Principal Reynolds addresses him.]
PRINCIPAL REYNOLDS : Linus, I don't have time to listen to you complain about detention.
BEN : That's not why I'm here. I want you to read something.
[Ben hands him a folder. The Principal takes the folder and walks behind his desk.]
PRINCIPAL REYNOLDS : Well, if this is some attempt to revive your little club ...
[The Principal opens the folder and begins to read. He looks up at Ben then sits.]
BEN : Those are thirty e-mails that cover a three month period. [smugly] It's pretty lascivious stuff, which would be fine if it was private, but they seem to describe acts that took place on school property. Acts which, morality aside, I think the school board would frown on, not to mention your wife.
PRINCIPAL REYNOLDS : What do you want?
BEN : Your job. You're gonna resign for, I don't know [pause] personal reasons, health, your call. But with your resignation you're gonna recommend that the school board hire me as your replacement. And the irony of all of this is that they hold you in such esteem, that I'll get the job. So, do we have an understanding?
PRINCIPAL REYNOLDS : Linus, may I read you an e-mail?
[The principal motions then Ben, to join him behind his desk. He invites Ben to look at his laptop monitor. He selects a particular e-mail from a list and opens it.]
PRINCIPAL REYNOLDS : "Dear Principal Reynolds, I would appreciate it if you could write a letter of recommendation to Yale on my behalf. It would mean the world to me. Sincerely, Alexandra Rousseau." It's a funny thing about recommendations, Linus. They work both ways. So [pause] I put the ball back in your court.
[The principal stands and sits in a chair in front of his desk.]
PRINCIPAL REYNOLDS : You can execute your little Machiavellian maneuvers, go for my job, sit at my desk. But, alas, there will be an unfortunate side effect. I will torch Miss Rousseau and her future. Is my job, my power, that important to you? So, what will it be [b]Dr.[/i] Linus?
[Ben looks at the principal stunned. A partial time skip sound is heard and the scene switches back to the island. Ben is still running from Ilana. As they reach the clearing, Ben looks around and finds the rifle. He quickly readies it and aims at Ilana.]
BEN : Drop it! Put the gun down.
[Ilana drops her rifle and raises her hands. She slowly approaches him, stops and drops her hands to her sides.]
ILANA : What are you waiting for?
BEN : I want to explain.
ILANA : Explain what?
BEN : I want to explain that I know what you're feeling.
ILANA : You have no idea what I'm feeling.
BEN : I watched my daughter, Alex, die in front of me. [voice cracks] And it was my fault. I had a chance to save her, but I chose the island [pause] over her , all in the name of Jacob. I sacrificed everything for him [lowers rifle] and he didn't even care. Yeah, I stabbed him. I was so [pause] angry, [paused] confused. I, I was terrified that I was about to lose the only thing that had ever mattered to me, my power. But the thing that really mattered was already gone. I'm sorry that I killed Jacob. I am and I do not expect you to forgive me because [pause] I can never forgive myself.
ILANA : Then what do you want?
BEN : Just [pause] let me leave.
ILANA : Where will you go?
BEN : To Locke.
ILANA : Why?
BEN : [sobs] Because he's the only one who that'll have me.
[Ilana softens her stance with Ben.]
ILANA : I'll have you.
[Ilana picks up her rifle and walks away from Ben who is left stunned. He slowly follows her back to the beach, carrying his rifle in front of him at waist height. school where Ben is looking into the office of Principal Reynolds. He enters to find no one there. The desk is neat and tidy with no open folders or laptops. He turns on a desk light which illuminates the nameplate on the desk: Donald Lawrence Reynolds  Principal. He picks it up then quickly puts it back on the desk. There is a knock at the office door. It is Alex.]
ALEX : Dr. Linus
BEN : Hello Alex.
ALEX : I was just coming by to thank Principal Reynolds. He wrote me the most incredible letter of recommendation.
BEN : Wow! Wonderful!
ALEX : Did you have something to do with it? I mean, I thought he might say some nice things, but he really went all out.
BEN : No, it wasn't me, Alex but I always say you're a great student. Obviously, I wasn't the only one who noticed.
ALEX : Thanks.
[Principal Reynolds enters his office.]
PRINCIPAL REYNOLDS : Linus, what the hell are you doing in my office?
BEN : Just dropping off the detention sign-up sheet for the week per your request.
PRINCIPAL REYNOLDS : Just put it on my desk.
[Ben puts the folder on the desk. The principal turns to Alex.]
BEN : [to Alex] So, will I see you at History Club?
ALEX : Uh, you mean when it's back on?
BEN : Oh, no. We've got our old slot back. Principal Reynolds found someone to cover for detention. [to Reynolds] Isn't that right?
PRINCIPAL REYNOLDS : Yes, that's right.
BEN : [to Alex] Well, then see you at four.
ALEX : Bye.
 outside the school. As Ben leaves the building, Atrz approaches him.]
LESLIE ARTZ : Hey, did you do it?
BEN : No.
LESLIE ARTZ : No? No?! Wait. What, what about my parking space?
BEN : You can have mine.
[Artz looks at Ben then walks away. Alex exits the building smiling then walks in the opposite direction as Ben. Ben begins to go his way. There is a partial time skip sound and the scene switches back to the jungle. Ilana is returning to the beach. Ben is following right behind. As they reach their destination, Ben pauses. Frank, Sun and Miles are working. Ben walks to the camp area. Frank and Miles look at Ben. Sun stops working. Ben approaches her and places the rifle down.]
BEN : Do you need a hand?
SUN : Please help me with the tarp.
[Ben nods and assists Sun. They work together. Frank places more wood on the fire. Miles examines the diamonds from Nikki and Paolo's grave. Ilana clutches the leather pouch with Jacob's ashes and cries. Frank stokes the fire. From behind, Hurley, Jack and Richard approach the group. Ilana is the first to notice the three men. Frank looks over his shoulder and Sun looks to her left side. Hurley sees Sun and smiles then the two run to each other and hug. Frank walks over and shakes Hurley's hand. Sun runs to Jack and they hug. Richard watches the reunions. Frank shakes Jack's hand. Miles is happy to see his friend, Hurley, again. Jack and Ilana shake hands. Ben stands off to the side, alone, makes eye contact with Jack and lowers his head. just above the ocean's surface. A periscope breaks through the water. It is focused on the group on the beach.]
MAN AT PERISCOPE : Sir, there are people on the beach. Should we stop?
WIDMORE : No. Proceed as planned.
MAN AT PERISCOPE : Yes, sir, Mr. Widmore.
[The man lowers the periscope.]
LOST logo
END

posts.author: Mel~Anie Zitat von Kitty85
posts.text:
Zitat von Kitty85 Was findest du denn am iPad lahm? Wir benutzen beide fast nur noch unsere Minis. Die Kröte nutzt hin und wieder ein ausrangiertes und für ihre Zwecke reicht das völlig.
Bei den Musikboxen finde ich doof, dass man sich so an ein System bindet und viele Figuren rumstehen hat. Wir haben uns dann als Familie eine Alexa zugelegt Bei Prime gibt es einige Hörspiele und wir hören viel Radio Ich beziehe das ja nicht aufs IPad allgemein, sondern auf meins. Und das ist ne Katastrophe. Nutze deswegen nur mein Handy, was ja iwie nicht Sinn der Sache ist. Es geht alles langsam, der Aufbau von Websites, der Wechsel zwischen den Apps,..
Das mit den Figuren hat man bei der TigerBox nicht. Ist wie ein portabler Lautsprecher und die Musik kommt aus dem Sd-Slot, wird drauf abgespeichert oder über Tablet / Handy übertragen. Alexa ist ja cool, aber z.B. für ne Autofahrt kannst du sie nicht mitgeben oder absolut ruhigen Gewissens bei Besuch ins Kinderzimmer oder in den Garten.

posts.author: Marina Smith (noreply@blogger.com)
posts.title: Flight instructor Dave Chael killed, flight school student, 39-year-old Cory Washburn critically injured, after their 1973 Beechcraft Bonanza V35B plane's landing gear impacted powerlines and terrain while on short final to Runway 17 at Alva Regional Airport (KAVK), Alva, Oklahoma
posts.text:
One killed, one injured in plane crash in Alva 

The Beachcraft Bonanza aircraft (just purchased by Washburn) was approaching the north side of the airport when the cowl hatch opened. Cory Washburn, 39, was piloting the aircraft at the time the cowl hatch opened; however, the pilot instructor, 61-year-old David Thomas Chael quickly took over, officials said. The landing gear deployed and the front wheel struck power lines. 
November 5, 2017 


ALVA, Okla. (AP) — 

Authorities in northwestern Oklahoma say a 61-year-old flight instructor is dead following the crash of a single-engine aircraft in Woods County.

The Oklahoma Highway Patrol says the crash occurred about 5:30 p.m. Saturday as the aircraft was approaching the Alva Municipal Airport. Troopers say a preliminary investigation indicates the aircraft experienced a mechanical failure during descent and that its landing gear struck some power lines. Authorities say the small aircraft struck some trees, plummeted to the ground and burst into flames.


Officials say the instructor, David Chael of Enid, was pronounced dead at the scene. A flight school student, 39-year-old Cory Washburn of Alva, was transported to a local hospital with undetermined injuries.The Federal Aviation Administration and the National Transportation Safety Board are investigating the cause of the fatal crash. 






ALVA, Okla. - We are learning new information about the deadly private plane crash in Alva. 

On Saturday, around 5:30 p.m., a private plane crashed in Alva, Oklahoma. 

Officials said the Beachcraft Bonanza aircraft was approaching the north side of the airport when the cowl hatch opened. 

Cory Washburn, 39, was piloting the aircraft at the time the cowl hatch opened; however, the pilot instructor, 61-year-old David Thomas Chael quickly took over, officials said. 

The landing gear deployed and the front wheel struck power lines. 

Officials say the aircraft then rolled over and came to a rest on its top. 

Authorities say Chael and Washburn were exiting the plane when the aircraft exploded. 

Chael was pronounced dead at the scene from massive injuries. 

Washburn was rushed to the hospital in critical condition. 

Officials say Washburn suffered burns over 80-percent of his body. 

According to the Alva Review-Courier, Washburn had purchased the Beachcraft Bonanza last week. 

He needed 15 hours of dual instruction before he could fly alone. 

Loved ones remember man killed in Alva plane crash 

Flight instructor worked with Enid church, Phillips University Legacy Foundation.  God could not save him, despite his good deeds! 




ENID, Okla. — 

Dave Chael died over the weekend in a fiery plane crash in Alva.

Chael, 61, was a husband, father, pilot and friend who was loved by many.


“From all aspects, we know Dave was one of the best pilots there ever was,” Don Bryant said. 

Chael was teaching Cory Washburn to fly when their plane crashed Saturday evening on Share Drive in Alva. The flight instructor died at the scene and Washburn survived.

“It’s been quite a shock,” Bryant said. “She just thought he was going out there to help someone learn to fly and then, of course, you get that phone call.”

Bryant is the interim pastor for Central Christian Church in Enid, where he said Chael was a very active member. Chael also was active with the Phillips University Legacy Foundation.

“Dave was the perfect mentor for our scholarship recipients,” said Kelly Coker, executive director of the Phillips University Legacy Foundation. “He was so insightful. He was always fun.”

“I know God’s got a lot of projects for you, and you’re at it right now,” friend Darrell Herndon said. 





Plane Crash In Alva Leaves One Dead  

November 05, 2017
By Jessi Mitchell, News 9



  ALVA, Oklahoma - 

Alva Police confirm a private plane has crashed north of the Share Medical Center, near Northwestern Oklahoma State University Ranger Field.

State troopers tell us a flight school student, 39-year-old Cory Washburn of Alva, and an instructor, 61-year-old David Chael of Enid,, were inbound to the Alva Municipal Airport when the small plane crashed around 5:30 this evening. Washburn suffered critical injuries and was rushed to the hospital. Chael was pronounced dead at the scene.

A witness described the plane as a ball of fire when it went down. Troopers tell us preliminary reports indicate a mechanical failure during the descent. The initial report from the Oklahoma Highway Patrol stated "(b)oth occupants were exiting the plane when it exploded."

“It's unclear what caused the malfunction with the aircraft,” said Trooper Justin Barney, "but the landing gear had been deployed and struck some power lines, causing it to go into some trees and then make contact with the ground.”

Another witness said the plane was flying low over the university football field just north of the crash site, then she saw smoke billowing up from behind a tree line. She says that smoke was flowing into Share Medical Center next to the crash site. The hospital had to evacuate some patients because power was knocked out but has since been restored.

Many of the homes in this neighborhood also lost power. Full power is expected to be restored around midnight.

Troopers are still notifying the victims’ next of kin so they have not yet released their names but say the student was taking private lessons from the pilot who was killed. Date: 04-NOV-2017 
Time: 17:27 LT 
Type: 
Beechcraft Bonanza V35B 
Owner/operator: Dan Howard AIircraft Sales LLC 
Registration: N777PH 
C/n / msn: D-9544 
Fatalities: Fatalities: 1 / Occupants: 2 
Other fatalities: 0 
Airplane damage: Written off (damaged beyond repair) 
Location: Alva Regional Airport (KAVK), Alva, OK - United States of America 
Phase: Landing 
Nature: Training 
Departure airport: Cherokee Muni (4O5) 
Destination airport: Alva Rgn’l (KAVK) 
Narrative:
The aircraft impacted powerlines and terrain while on short final to Runway 17 at Alva Regional Airport (KAVK), Alva, Oklahoma. The airplane was partially consumed by the post-impact fire and one of the two pilots onboard was fatally injured, the other one received critical injuries.

posts.title: موقع إسرائيلي: تغييرات كبيرة ومفاجئة في قيادة الجيش الإيراني !!
posts.text:
ذكر موقع "ديبكا" الإسرائيلي المقرب من دوائر الإستخبارات الإسرائيلية أن المرشد الأعلى للجمهورية الإيرانية آية الله على خامنئ أمر بإجراء تغييرات كبيرة في مراكز عليا في قيادة الجيش الإيراني والحرس الثوري.
وأشار الموقع أن العميد محمد حسين تم تعيينه نائبا لرئيس الأركان، وأن الخامنئي طلب منه في رسالة التعيين أن يساهم في أن يكون الجيش الإيراني أكثر مهنية مما هو عليه وخاصة في الأمور الإستخباراتية والحربية، وأضاف الموقع أن خامنائي عين أيضا الجينرال حسين خنزادي قائدا للبحرية الايرانية.
ونقل موقع ديبكا عن مصادره، أن الخامنئي قام بتعيين حبيب الله سياري نائبا لرئيس الأركان في ما يخص تنسيق العمليات، وذكر الموقع أن حبيب الله يعتبر أحد القادة البارزين في الحرس الثوري سابقا وكان مسؤولا عن تدريب الكوماندز الإيراني، وهو الذي أشرف على عملية اعتقال المارينز في الخليج العربي قبل سنوات، كما ويعتبر أهم من طور أساليب مكافحة الإرهاب في إيران.
وبيّن الموقع أن خامنئي أكد فى إعلانه أن جميع التعيينات الجديدة تمت بموافقة واعتماد اللواء عبد الرحيم موسوي رئيس اركان الجيش الإيراني.
ويشير الموقع أن هذه التغييرات في قيادة الجيش والبحرية الإيرانية، تأتي مع تزايد حدة التوتر بين المملكة العربية السعودية ودولة الإمارات العربية المتحدة في الأيام القليلة الماضية.
 واعتبر الموقع أن هذه التغييرات بمثابة استعداد للحرب، لأن التصريحات التي تصدر من السعودية لا يمكن تفسيرها إلا تصريحات إعلان حرب، ويلفت الموقع أن تصريحات السعودية تعد تغيرا واضحا في الخطاب السعودي وبشكل حاد، معتبرا أن إسرائيل رغم عدائها مع إيران لم تصدر هكذا تصريحات أبدا، لأن ذلك يعني حرب.
